snippet.title: Tedx looking for speakers
snippet.content: GOT something to say? TEDxADELAIDE is looking for speakers for its 2017 event which is being held on November 2. TEDx is an independently organised offshoot off the TED talks - talks which cover technology, entertainment and design with the philosophy that they are "ideas worth spreading''. This year's speakers at the Adelaide event include Peter Walker, who will be talking about whether separate schools for autistic children are a good idea, entrepreneur and multiskilled actor, writer and consultant Bill Allert, speaking on the idea of metamorphosis, and Gabrielle Kelly, the inaugural director of the Wellbeing and Resilience Centre at the SAHMRI. Ms Kelly will be talking about South Australia's opportunity to become the " State of Wellbeing", with her current role focused on how to embed positive psychology and the science of wellbeing and resilience in our community. To get involved head to Tickets will go on sale about six weeks out.
